verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of king <S%H4428><s%> Lemuel <S%H3927><s%>, the prophecy <S%H4853><s%> that his mother <S%H517><s%> taught <S%H3256><s%> him.
What, my son <S%H1248><s%>? and what, the son <S%H1248><s%> of my womb <S%H990><s%>? and what, the son <S%H1248><s%> of my vows <S%H5088><s%>?
Give <S%H5414><s%> not thy strength <S%H2428><s%> unto women <S%H802><s%>, nor thy ways <S%H1870><s%> to that which destroyeth <S%H4229><s%> kings <S%H4428><s%>.

It is not for kings <S%H4428><s%>, O Lemuel <S%H3927><s%>, it is not for kings <S%H4428><s%> to drink <S%H8354><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%>; nor for <S%H335><s%> <S%H176><s%> princes <S%H7336><s%> strong drink <S%H7941><s%>:

Lest they drink <S%H8354><s%>, and forget <S%H7911><s%> the law <S%H2710><s%>, and pervert <S%H8138><s%> the judgment <S%H1779><s%> of any of the afflicted <S%H1121><s%> <S%H6040><s%>. prevert: Heb. alter of any: Heb. of all the sons of affliction

Give <S%H5414><s%> strong drink <S%H7941><s%> unto him that is ready to perish <S%H6><s%>, and wine <S%H3196><s%> unto those that be of heavy <S%H4751><s%> hearts <S%H5315><s%>. of: Heb. bitter of soul
Let him drink <S%H8354><s%>, and forget <S%H7911><s%> his poverty <S%H7389><s%>, and remember <S%H2142><s%> his misery <S%H5999><s%> no more.

Open <S%H6605><s%> thy mouth <S%H6310><s%> for the dumb <S%H483><s%> in the cause <S%H1779><s%> of all such as are appointed <S%H1121><s%> to destruction <S%H2475><s%>. such: Heb. the sons of destruction
Open <S%H6605><s%> thy mouth <S%H6310><s%>, judge <S%H8199><s%> righteously <S%H6664><s%>, and plead <S%H1777><s%> the cause of the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy <S%H34><s%>.
Who can find <S%H4672><s%> a virtuous <S%H2428><s%> woman <S%H802><s%>? for her price <S%H4377><s%> is far <S%H7350><s%> above rubies <S%H6443><s%>.
The heart <S%H3820><s%> of her husband <S%H1167><s%> doth safely trust <S%H982><s%> in her, so that he shall have no need <S%H2637><s%> of spoil <S%H7998><s%>.
She will do <S%H1580><s%> him good <S%H2896><s%> and not evil <S%H7451><s%> all the days <S%H3117><s%> of her life <S%H2416><s%>.
She seeketh <S%H1875><s%> wool <S%H6785><s%>, and flax <S%H6593><s%>, and worketh <S%H6213><s%> willingly <S%H2656><s%> with her hands <S%H3709><s%>.
She is like the merchants' <S%H5503><s%> ships <S%H591><s%>; she bringeth <S%H935><s%> her food <S%H3899><s%> from afar <S%H4801><s%>.

She riseth <S%H6965><s%> also while it is yet night <S%H3915><s%>, and giveth <S%H5414><s%> meat <S%H2964><s%> to her household <S%H1004><s%>, and a portion <S%H2706><s%> to her maidens <S%H5291><s%>.

She considereth <S%H2161><s%> a field <S%H7704><s%>, and buyeth <S%H3947><s%> it: with the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of her hands <S%H3709><s%> she planteth <S%H5193><s%> a vineyard <S%H3754><s%>. buyeth: Heb. taketh
She girdeth <S%H2296><s%> her loins <S%H4975><s%> with strength <S%H5797><s%>, and strengtheneth <S%H553><s%> her arms <S%H2220><s%>.
She perceiveth <S%H2938><s%> that her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> is good <S%H2896><s%>: her candle <S%H5216><s%> goeth not out <S%H3518><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%>. She: Heb. She tasteth
She layeth <S%H7971><s%> her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the spindle <S%H3601><s%>, and her hands <S%H3709><s%> hold <S%H8551><s%> the distaff <S%H6418><s%>.
She stretcheth out <S%H6566><s%> her hand <S%H3709><s%> to the poor <S%H6041><s%>; yea, she reacheth forth <S%H7971><s%> her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the needy <S%H34><s%>. She: Heb. She spreadeth

She is not afraid <S%H3372><s%> of the snow <S%H7950><s%> for her household <S%H1004><s%>: for all her household <S%H1004><s%> are clothed <S%H3847><s%> with scarlet <S%H8144><s%>. scarlet: or, double garments
She maketh <S%H6213><s%> herself coverings of tapestry <S%H4765><s%>; her clothing <S%H3830><s%> is silk <S%H8336><s%> and purple <S%H713><s%>.
Her husband <S%H1167><s%> is known <S%H3045><s%> in the gates <S%H8179><s%>, when he sitteth <S%H3427><s%> among the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>.
She maketh <S%H6213><s%> fine linen <S%H5466><s%>, and selleth <S%H4376><s%> it; and delivereth <S%H5414><s%> girdles <S%H2289><s%> unto the merchant <S%H3669><s%>.
Strength <S%H5797><s%> and honour <S%H1926><s%> are her clothing <S%H3830><s%>; and she shall rejoice <S%H7832><s%> in time <S%H3117><s%> to come <S%H314><s%>.
She openeth <S%H6605><s%> her mouth <S%H6310><s%> with wisdom <S%H2451><s%>; and in her tongue <S%H3956><s%> is the law <S%H8451><s%> of kindness <S%H2617><s%>.
She looketh well <S%H6822><s%> to the ways <S%H1979><s%> <S%H1979><s%> of her household <S%H1004><s%>, and eateth <S%H398><s%> not the bread <S%H3899><s%> of idleness <S%H6104><s%>.
Her children <S%H1121><s%> arise up <S%H6965><s%>, and call her blessed <S%H833><s%>; her husband <S%H1167><s%> also, and he praiseth <S%H1984><s%> her.
Many <S%H7227><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%> have done <S%H6213><s%> virtuously <S%H2428><s%>, but thou excellest <S%H5927><s%> them all. have: or, have gotten riches

Favour <S%H2580><s%> is deceitful <S%H8267><s%>, and beauty <S%H3308><s%> is vain <S%H1892><s%>: but a woman <S%H802><s%> that feareth <S%H3373><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, she shall be praised <S%H1984><s%>.
Give <S%H5414><s%> her of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of her hands <S%H3027><s%>; and let her own works <S%H4639><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> her in the gates <S%H8179><s%>.
